text: [[b]]Defenders of the Empire[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Spear infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: frontline\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Unbreakable\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Missile defence\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The empire is, above all, imbued with the will of heaven. It will be defended![[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Tyrant Slayers[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Shock cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: flanking\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Strong charge\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good against generals\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The leaders of the land are tainted by corruption, and must be cleansed with steel.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Handmaid Guard[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Melee cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters of rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: anti-missile\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good morale \\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Missile defence\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]As bodyguards for nobles, the Handmaid Guard are particularly fearsome, able to stand toe-to-toe with any of China's best fighters.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Qiang Raiders[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Melee cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 5 or higher\\n\\nRole: flanking\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Fatigue immunity\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. spears\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Merciless tribal cavalry, crashing into enemies with a devastating charge and dispatching any survivors with swords.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Xiliang Cavalry[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Shock cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good charge\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Weak against missile attacks\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Trained in the tradition of nomadic horsemen, the speed and power of this cavalry’s charge scatter all before it.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Qiang Hunters[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Horse archers[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: skirmisher\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Fatigue immunity\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Melee\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Tribal archers who excel at skirmishing due to their accuracy, endurance and long polearms to counter enemy cavalry assaults.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Enforced Conscription[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Military building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Starting rank for new recruits \\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Seasonal retinue deployment \\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] {{tr:Public_order}}\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Mustering time\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Redeployment cost \\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Population growth \\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Even with a standing army, the realm’s stability must be assured by drawing bodies from the population – willingly or otherwise![[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Chu Spearman[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Polearm infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: anti-cavalry\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Great against armored cavalry\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]These spearmen are trained to hold the line, thrusting out at any who would oppose them, or their lord![[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Bonds of Family[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Passive effect[[/col]]\\n\\nReduced cost of marrying and adopting characters.\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]In the far south, far from the capital, there is nothing more important than a strong, powerful family.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Domain[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Government type[[/col]]\\n\\nRestricts the number of {{tr:map_regions}} that can be governed without penalties\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]One's domain cannot outreach one's jurisdiction, lest order succumb to chaos.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Tiger Slingers[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Ranged infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 1 or higher\\n\\nRole: skirmishers\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Causes scare\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Has wild animals\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]All will fight in the defence of their leader, but others will fight all the more fiercely to avenge them.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Territorial Spearmen[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Spear infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: anti-cavalry\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Morale when defending\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Melee defence when defending\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Melee damage when defending\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Weak against missile attacks\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Put a spear in these men's hands and they will fight. Against all odds, for their homes, they will fight…[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Qiang Hunters[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Horse archers[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: skirmisher\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Fatigue immunity\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Melee\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Tribal archers who excel at skirmishing due to their accuracy, endurance and long polearms to counter enemy cavalry assaults.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Qiang Raiders[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Melee cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 5 or higher\\n\\nRole: flanking\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Fatigue immunity\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. spears\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Merciless tribal cavalry, crashing into enemies with a devastating charge and dispatching any survivors with swords.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Lord of the Five Valleys[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Faction feature[[/col]]\\n\\n[[i]]Fealties are gained through conquering Nanman factions. Each tribe starts with one and must gather the others to unite the tribes.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]All that you see before you... this is the land of the five valleys..[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Nanzhong Elephants[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Elephants[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 1 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Elephant unit\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Small unit\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Any army that marches with elephants already have superiority when it comes to morale.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Unify[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Diplomatic option[[/col]]\\n\\nCan confederate other factions from the start of a campaign\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]People and heroes alike will rally behind a virtuous leader.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Xiliang Supply Lines[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Military building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Food from foraging\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Cavalry recruit rank\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Military supplies for friendly forces\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Military supplies for hostile forces\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Xiliang supply lines use foraging techniques and mounted troops to deliver provisions, while simultaneously disrupting supply routes for trespassing armies.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Zhong Administration[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Governmental building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from all sources\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Economic, learning and market construction costs\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Legitimacy\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The Zhong combine the administrative experience of their Yuan lineage with the vigour of a new dynasty carved from sheer ambition.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Schemes[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Faction feature[[/col]]\\n\\nSet nefarious plans into action upon local or foreign entities.\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]All manner of surreptitious plans, both at home and abroad, can be put into motion.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Qi Crossbowmen[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Armoured crossbowmen[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: rear line\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Great against armor units\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Weak in melee\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Against the toughest armour, a crossbow bolt will still slow you down. Against the defenceless, however…[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Military Security[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Military building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Noble support \\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from all sources \\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Prestige\\nProvides additional garrison\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Only in strong defence lies the path to ultimate success.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Infantry of Jing[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Polearm infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: anti-cavalry\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Armour\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Morale\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]The Infantry of Jing are charged by Liu Biao to guard the flanks against enemy missiles and brace their spears against cavalry charges.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Nanzhong Champions[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Frontline infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]]Good against shields\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]]Missile defence\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]The greatest warriors of one of the greatest leaders of the Nanman.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Judiciary[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Administration building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Jurisdiction\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Vassal Tribute\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Justice flows from the emperor, through his administrators, to the people below.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Messengers of Heaven[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Melee cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: flanking\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good morale\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Movement Speed\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good charge\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Cause fear\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Missile defence\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Low armour\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The message the Yellow Turbans deliver is one of justice over corruption, with thundering hooves and furious charge.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Gallants of the People[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Spear infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: frontline\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good armour\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good morale\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Encourage\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Bravery drives a warrior to battle more effectively than any general; a good spear and shield keeps them there.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Flying Riders[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Shock cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: flanking\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good armour\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] good charge\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]There is no battle line, no formation, that these warriors cannot see put to ruin.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Present Gift[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Court action[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Satisfaction\\nImproves relationship\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]A gift, presented in gratitude and generosity.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Wuling Fighters[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Sword & shield infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nRole: assault infantry\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Large health pool\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Increased damage to characters\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Well armed and armoured these men are tough enough to survive all but the mightiest of blows, use these men to cut even down the mightiest heroes.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Warriors of Xu[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Frontline infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: frontline\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] High health\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Missile defence\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]A good axe and a strong arm are as good as any spear, sword or bow.[[/col]][[/i]]

Unlocked from the start:\\n[[b]]Guardians of the Land[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Heavy assault infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nRole: frontline\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good armour\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good in melee\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]] Armoured former palace guards who use ji polearms raided from their previous masters in the fight for the Great Peace.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Mercenary Cavalry[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Shock cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 5 or higher\\n\\nRole: flanking\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. missile\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Cavalry troops who fight only for gold; excellent at capturing key strategic points and fighting in hot climates.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Tuntian Conscription[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Military building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Starting rank for new recruits\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Movement range for armies\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Seasonal retinue \\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Food from farming\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Agricultural garrison cost \\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Population growth\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Conscription raises troops from the population, improving the efficiency of agricultural garrisons and increasing replenishment across your commanderies.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Captain Retinues[[/b]]\\n\\nInstead of heroic characters, Sima Jiong can employ lower-ranked officers and captains who lead retinues of various unit compositions.\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Leading their men as first among equals, captains will follow your orders without hesitation.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Shu Han Tax Collection[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Governmental building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Peasantry income\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Militia replenishment\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]A Shu Han tax administration oversees the collection of taxes with the good of the people in mind, ensuring all pay a fair and equal share.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Judiciary[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Administration building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Subterfuge\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from family estates\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Justice flows from the emperor, through his administrators, to the people below.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Business Ventures[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Economic assignment[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from commerce\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Your attendant will launch business ventures and oversee them within the commandery, making sure that the return from investment meets the standards of your house.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Teachings of Heaven[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Heaven assignment[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Replenishment [[col:scope_description]](allied armies in adjacent {{tr:map_provinces}})[[/col]]\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Replenishment [[col:scope_description]](own armies in adjacent {{tr:map_provinces}})[[/col]]\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Population growth [[col:scope_description]](local {{tr:map_province}})[[/col]]\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Diplomatic relations with Han Empire factions\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Your attendant will go into the towns and villages, spreading the word of heaven and bringing new followers to the cause.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Imperial Guards[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Frontline infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: frontline\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Great defence\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]In defence of the emperor, there is no lengths to which these soldiers would not go.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Yuan Administration Office[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Governmental building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from all sources\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] {{tr:Public_order}}\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Lineage\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Bureaucracy courses through the blood of the Yuan family, resulting in an efficient and experienced administration run by the finest officials.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Fealty of the Fire People[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Faction feature[[/col]]\\n\\n[[i]]Fealties are gained through conquering Nanman factions. Each tribe starts with one Fealty, and must gather the others to unite the tribes.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]These are the flames not so easily doused.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]White Tiger Warriors[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Assault infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 2 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good against shields\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Splash attacks\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The White Tiger Warriors follow their leader, Yan Baihu, into battle no matter the cost and no matter the result.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Aid the Wounded[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Occupation option[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Population growth\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from commerce\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The people must be cared for – otherwise this war is for nothing![[/co]][[/i]]

[[b]]Coerce[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Diplomatic action[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Swings diplomatic deals in your favour\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Momentum\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Only a fool would attempt to object when the dragon decides to act![[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Restructure Administration[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Administration assignment[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Reformation\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Reformation from buildings\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Your attendant will see to the reformation and restructuring of the local administration and of the commandery government.[[/col]][[/i]]\\n\\n[[b]]Regulate Markets[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Economic assignment[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Reformation\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from commerce, silk, and spice\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Your attendant will oversee and regulate local markets, increasing the tax paid by local merchants and traders.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Black Mountain Outlaws[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Melee infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: anti-cavalry\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Causes scare\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Guerrilla deployment\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Fearless bandits unafraid to brace themselves against heavy cavalry and pierce horses’ armour with their long qiang spears.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Fury of Beihai[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Crossbow infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: skirmisher\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Armour-piercing\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. cavalry\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]These elite soldiers are armed with long-range crossbows powerful enough to pierce armour.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Yi Archers[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Archer infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: rear line\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Melee\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. cavalry\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]These archers’ long siyah horn bows increase the velocity of their arrows while they fend off attackers with zhibeidao swords.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Black Mountain Hunters[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Archer infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 5 or higher\\n\\nRole: rear line\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Causes scare\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Guerrilla deployment\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Fearless bandits armed with axes and composite bows; accuracy is less vital when you can sneak up on the enemy.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Judiciary[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Administration building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Control\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Corruption\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Justice flows from the emperor, through his administrators, to the people below.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Lodging[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Learning & markets building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Governance\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Character experience\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from commerce\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]An enlightened and civilised society offers accommodation for travellers, and where tea is available, wisdom and conversation – for a price, of course.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Provincial Advisor[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Ministerial position[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Corruption\\nEnables Provincial Inspection assignment\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The provincial advisor is a representative of the central government, sent to the commanderies for supervision; and for control.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Hidden Axes[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Assault infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Charge\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. cavalry\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Zheng Jiang arms her fiercest bandits with fu axes and deploys them to charge into enemy infantry.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Dongzhoubing Marksmen[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Archer infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for all characters\\n\\nRole: skirmishers\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Guerrilla deployment\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Poor in melee\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Raining down arrows from a distance is a sure way to thin an enemy's ranks before any swordsman has shed a single drop of blood.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Wuling Slingers[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Missile infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nRole: skirmish infantry\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Ignore terrain penalties\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] High mobility\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Able to out-manoeuvre slower more heavily armed infantry these units are able to evade and deliver missile attacks, able to wear down slower units.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Camp Crushers[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Shock infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good armour\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Splash attacks\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]To break these warriors is the challenge of many an army. So far, very few have succeeded.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Shanyue Camp[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Unique minor settlement option[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Food from banditry\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Bandit Network research rate\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]The Shanyue know the hills of the south better than any, and amidst the dramatic scenery, their fortresses rise; places to live and grow, away from both the extremeties of the elements and the eyes of the enemy.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Thunder of Jian'an[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Crossbow infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: skirmisher\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Armour-piercing\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. cavalry\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]These elite troops’ armour protects them in close combat, enabling them to fight when not using their long-range, armour-piercing crossbows.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Tiger Warriors[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Assault infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 1 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good against shields\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Has wild animals\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The tiger is the lord of beasts. In war, the mere sight of such a creature can unmake the bravest warrior.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Defenders of Hebei[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Polearm infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: all-rounder\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Charge\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. missile\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Heavily-armoured infantry that hold the main battle line with polearms from Yuan Shao’s personal armoury.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Coerce[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Diplomatic action[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Chance of accepting deals\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Intimidation\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Dong Zhuo is able to exercise his power over lesser rivals and bend them to his will![[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Fists of the Bandit Queen[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Assault infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]]Charge\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. cavalry\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]These elite, battle-hardened bandits carry an axe in each hand, and advance ahead of the frontlines to catch their foes unawares.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Discipline of the Land[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Land assignment[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Morale [[col:scope_description]](enemy armies in adjacent {{tr:map_provinces}})[[/col]]\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] {{tr:dlc04_term_regional_fervour}} [[col:scope_description]](adjacent {{tr:map_provinces}})[[/col]]\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Population growth [[col:scope_description]](local {{tr:map_province}})[[/col]]\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Diplomatic relations with Han Empire factions\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Your attendant walks the lands training and inspiring your troops to greater feats of valour.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Dongzhoubing Defenders[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Spear infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for all characters\\n\\nRole: anti-cavalry\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good against mounted\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Has ranged weapon\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]With spear and shield, these well armoured infantrymen are ferocious in battle, steadfast in defence of their general.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Farming Garrisons[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Agricultural building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Improved garrisons[[/col]]\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Food\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Military district cost\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Replenishment\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Soldiers farm the land to supply food for your armies, simultaneously defending it and increasing food yield in the area.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Micromanage Commandery[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Administration assignment[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from all sources\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Corruption\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Control\\nOnly available to faction leader, faction heir or advisor\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The faction leader will personally oversee administration and government in the local commandery.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Territorial Archers[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Archer infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: rear line\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Morale when defending\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Melee defence when defending\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Ranged damage when defending\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Weak against cavalry\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]They may not be trained in the formal ways of war, but battle will teach them... or not.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]War Elephants[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Elephants[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 1 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]]Elephant unit\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Small unit\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]As though elephants were not mighty enough, these beasts have even more power![[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Tribute Chests[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Ancillary[[/col]]\\n\\nA set of ancillaries exclusive to this faction. The Tribute Chest confers powerful bonuses to the characters to whom they are equipped.\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Shi Xie is known for lavish gifts and tributes. These offerings have the power of motivating even the weakest minds into decisive action.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Heavy Xiliang Cavalry[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Shock cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good charge\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Weak against missile attacks\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The best riders are rewarded with iron armour to maximise their devastating flanking charge.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Mercenary Outpost[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Economic building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Grants access to Mercenaries[[/col]]\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from commerce\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Replenishment\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Without inheriting authority, wealth's greatest use is for attaining power, so the brave can serve China regardless of their heritage.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Xiongnu Cavalry[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Shock cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Great charge\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Nomads, masters of cavalry, know exactly how and where to deploy their armoured horses for maximum devastation.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Academies of Culture[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Learning building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Population growth\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from all sources\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] {{tr:Public_order}}\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The Kong family rightfully claim Confucius as an ancestor, and fittingly, their schools promote enlightenment and poetry for financial and cultural betterment.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Raze[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Occupation option[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Razes the settlement[[/col]]\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Intimidation\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The price is treason is known: no mercy![[/co]][[/i]]

[[b]]Guerilla Warfare[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Military building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Post-battle loot income\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Military supplies\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]When fighting a greater opponent, remain flexible and use cunning and surprise.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Yi Marksmen[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Archer infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: rear line\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Melee\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. cavalry\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Highly-trained archers outfitted with leather armour and armed with zhibeidao swords to defend against infantry attacks.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Gardens[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Governmental building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Research rate\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Satisfaction\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Make room for nature and pleasure.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Followers Of The Flame[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Assault infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 1 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Splash attacks\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Does fire damage\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]With bruising mace and burning fire, a foe is soon dealt with.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Xu raiders[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Shock infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good charge\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Swift movement and deadly action are the essence of war. These warriors are fast as lightning, and just as lethal.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Chosen of the Eight Immortals[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Melee infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good morale\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Strong charge\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Armour Piercing\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Unbreakable\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Low armour\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Small unit size\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]With a short spear in each hand, the chosen warriors stride forth, uncaring of the danger, towards destiny.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Loyalty of the Beasts[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Faction feature[[/col]]\\n\\n[[i]]Fealties are gained through conquering Nanman factions. Each tribe starts with one and must gather the others to unite the tribes.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]All things natural can be controlled by those who respect them.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Chu Infantry[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Frontline infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Great against infantry\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]These swordsmen take the fight to the enemy in the name of their prince![[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Liberate[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Stance[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] {{tr:Public_order}} in enemy commanderies\\nSteals food and reserves from local region\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The people will be freed from the Han’s corrupted grip![[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Mercenary Archers[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Archer infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: rear line\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Melee\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. cavalry\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Arid heat has no effect on the performance or accuracy of these archers, who excel in capturing key strategic points.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Heavy Tiger & Leopard Cavalry[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Shock cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: all-rounder\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Defence vs. missile\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Low damage\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Clad in full armour, these elite cavalry troops deflect arrows with their shields as they bear down on their enemies.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Military Supervision[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Economic assignment[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from all sources\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Noble support\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Your attendant will ensure military supervision of the local populace and their activities.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Warriors of the Left[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Assault infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: frontline\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Morale\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. cavalry\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Many enemies fall to the jian blades of these elite, heavily-armoured swordsmen defending the line in service of Yuan Shu.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Imperial Defenders[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Polearm infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: anti-cavalry\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Armour\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Morale\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Elite spear infantry, hand-picked by Liu Biao to defend and hold the line behind their robust tower shields.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Incite the People[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]People assignment[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Attrition [[col:scope_description]](enemy armies in local {{tr:map_province}})[[/col]]\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Campaign movement range [[col:scope_description]](enemy armies in local {{tr:map_province}})[[/col]]\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Supplies [[col:scope_description]](enemy armies in adjacent {{tr:map_provinces}})[[/col]]\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Population growth [[col:scope_description]](local {{tr:map_province}})[[/col]]\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Diplomatic relations with Han Empire factions\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Your attendant spreads word of enemy forces, asking all the people to rise up and defend the lands![[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Labour[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Economic building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Population growth\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Construction cost\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Work provides a living wage, and the promise of homes for labourers will attract people to the area seeking stability against chaos.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Xianbei Riders[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Shock cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: flanking\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Great charge\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Light, manoeuvrable cavalry can create chaos and confusion in the enemy ranks and, ultimately, victory.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Mercenary Treaty[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Diplomatic treaty[[/col]]\\n\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Declare war on mercenary master's target[[/col]]\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Earn money per turn\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Sell conquered land to mercenary master for large sums\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Hiring out one's martial skills is a very risky endeavour. If only it didn't pay so well...[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Conscription[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Military building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Starting rank for new recruits \\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Seasonal retinue deployment \\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Replenishment\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Redeployment cost\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]A tempestuous general requires furious soldiers![[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Qi Guardsmen[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Polearm infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: all-rounder\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good against mounted\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Great armour\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Movement is its own form of strength. What this unit may lack in armour it makes up for in versatility.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Loyalty to the Han[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Path to victory[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]]Cannot declare as emperor by creating an emperor seat[[/col]]\\nCan become emperor by capturing the capital of an existing emperor\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Ambition is tamed by respect and loyalty towards the Han and its emperors.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Reward the Nobility[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Administration assignment[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Noble support\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Your attendant will bestow rewards and gifts to representatives of the people and the local nobility.[[/col]][[/i]]\\n\\n[[b]]Rally Conscripts[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Military assignment[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Replenishment\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Your attendant will use the enthusiasm you instil in the populace to rally conscripts and supporters.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Reformed Infrastructure[[/b]]\\n\\nBuildings in commandery capitals will impact the increase and decrease of reformation.\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The hand that guides the most is invisible.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Nanzhong Spearmen[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Polearm infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nRole: anti-cavalry\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]]Good against mounted\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]]Weak against missile attacks\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]A phalanx of spears will see off most enemies.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Imperial Army[[/b]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Elite units\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Very low replenishment\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Command of the imperial army will demonstrate to all who holds the true power in China![[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Qiang Marauders[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Shock cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 1 or higher\\n\\nRole: flanking\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Fatigue immunity\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. missile\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Tribal horsemen whose ferocity and unrelenting attacks on exposed flanks are matched only by their riding skills.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Black Mountain Hideout[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Governmental building[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] {{tr:Public_order}}\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Underling limit \\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Diplomatic relations with Han Empire factions\\n\\nOR\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Army limit\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Loot income\\n\\nOR\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Diplomatic relations with Yellow Turban factions\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Spy limit\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Divergent paths grant new opportunities: administration of the Han Empire, sanctuary for the expelled or riches from banditry.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Bandit Lair[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Agriculture building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Replenishment\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Income\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Even though Zheng Jiang would eventually rise to become a warlord in China, she never abandoned her roots as a bandit. Even more so, she relied on her bandit splinter groups to retain control of her territory and to ensure her rule is undisputed.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Teaching Assignment[[/b]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Experience [[col:scope_description]](all characters in local {{tr:map_province}})[[/col]]\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Experience [[col:scope_description]](all characters in adjacent {{tr:map_provinces}})[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Sent out to the country, your attendant will teach your officers, giving them increased experience.[[/col]][[/i]]

Unlocked from the start:\\n[[b]]Youxia[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Heavy assault infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nRole: frontline\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good armour\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Guerrilla deployment\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]] With a tally of many victories between them, this armoured infantry form the vanguard of the frontline with sword and shield. [[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Centralised Government[[/b]]\\n\\nMinisterial positions reduce control of the faction leader\\nUnique court action to remove opposition by casting out powerful characters\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Some responsibility should be delegated, you suppose, but you'll be sure to see that your subjects adhere to your grand designs.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]White Horse Raiders[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Mounted archers[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: skirmisher\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Mobility\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Armour\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Elite troops, personally selected by Gongsun Zan to ride white horses, harass enemies with arrows while remaining out of reach.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Tiger Guard[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Assault infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: frontline\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Blocks melee attacks\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good against mounted\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Not even the death of their lord can stay their fury; if anything, these warriors will fight ever-more fanatically to avenge a fallen master than when he lived. [[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Archers Of Jing[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Archer infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: rear line\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Great ranged damage\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Lots of ammunition\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]It takes a very steady hand, supreme patience, and expert timing to land a shot as accurately as these bowmen.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Court Scholars[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Court position[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Character experience\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Over time, the good student eventually becomes the master.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Destroyers of Treachery[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Shock cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good charge\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Splash attack\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]There can be no mercy for treason. Justice will be delivered at the point of these warrior's spears.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Inheritance[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Faction feature[[/col]]\\n\\n[[i]]Through ambitious actions, whether they be through conquest, construction or missions, this faction can inherit powerful bonuses to counties, characters and faction-wide buffs. [[/i]]\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]First, there must be something to inherit. Action taken now will make both ourselves and the generations to come ready for whatever the future holds...[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]White Horse Fellows[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Mounted archers[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: skirmisher\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Melee\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Mobility\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Elite troops, personally selected by Gongsun Zan to ride white horses, harass enemies with arrows while remaining out of reach.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Tiger & Leopard Cavalry[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Shock cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: all-rounder\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Defence vs. missile\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Low damage\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Equipped with partial iron armour and highly-protective shields, these disciplined elite cavalry hunt down enemies armed with missile weapons.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Military Emissary[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Ministerial position[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]] Recruitment cost\\nEnables Military Interference assignment\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]This position is a military representative to the government, liaising between civic and military departments of the government.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Mercenary Infantry[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Assault infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 1 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. cavalry\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Infantry-for-hire, they easily weather hot climates and are best used to capture key strategic points on the battlefield.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Warriors of Ye[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Polearm infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: all-rounder\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Charge\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. missile\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Selected by Yuan Shao, the Warriors of Ye are protected by iron plates and use their polearms to pierce heavy cavalry's armour.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Ravine Warriors[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Assault infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 1 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good against shields\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Expendable\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]In case the foe survives a charging elephant, the Ravine Warriors follow in the beasts' wake, a weapon in each hand.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Rapid Tiger Infantry[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Assault infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: frontline\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Morale\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. cavalry\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]These troops have been selected for their skill in the ancient fighting style with the jian sword - a deadly weapon when mastered.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]The Captain Armoury[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Faction feature[[/col]]\\n\\n[[i]]The captain armoury gives access to a wide range of unique bonuses that can be used to customise and strengthen your captain retinues.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Leading their men as first amongst equals, captains will follow your orders without hesitation.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Reward Officials[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Political assignment[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Political influence\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Character experience\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Food\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Public order\\n[[col:scope_description]]\\nOnly available to faction leader, faction heir or advisor\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]You will attend to matters of court and bestow rewards and honours upon your ministers. This will help develop your political influence, but the extra taxes will no doubt upset the populace.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Reformation[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Faction respecification[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] / [[col:red]]-[[/col]] Faction diplomatic relations\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] / [[col:red]]-[[/col]] Character satisfaction\\n\\n Alternative government types\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The wider world is changing and the Nanman must decide their place in it. Along which path will you lead the people?[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Zealots of the Way[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Polearm infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: frontline\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good morale\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good in melee\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Charge reflect\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Missile defence\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]A glaive is a most powerful weapon, and zealotry more powerful still.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]White Tiger Raiders[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Archer infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 4 or higher\\n\\nRole: skirmishers\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Guerrilla deployment\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Paltry armour\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]] The raiders of the White Tiger move swiftly, with swiftness of the gale, striking hard in key locations before vanishing back to a safe distance.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Qiang Marauders[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Shock cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 1 or higher\\n\\nRole: flanking\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Fatigue immunity\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Defence vs. missile\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Tribal horsemen whose ferocity and unrelenting attacks on exposed flanks are matched only by their riding skills.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Integrate[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Settlement action[[/col]]\\n\\nAnnexes and integrates Han Empire settlements\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]All people must know peace and unity – this is the only true victory.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]True Leader of the Nanman[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Faction feature[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Diplomatic Relations with Nanman factions\\n\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Diplomatic relations with Han Chinese factions.\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]I am a Nanman, through and through – I will protect my people and crush my enemies.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Chen Peacekeepers[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Melee cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: anti-missile\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good morale\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good armour\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Ranged opener\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Encourage\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]In defence of their prince, these warriors shall ride to whatever end.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Xianbei Horse Archers[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Harassing unit[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: skirmishers\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] High rate of fire\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Great mobility\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The Xianbei were infamous, feared for their lightning-fast attacks and ceaseless harassment of their foes.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Village Healer[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Economic building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Population growth\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] {{tr:Public_order}}\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Before growth can happen, sickness must be cured.[[/co]][[/i]]

[[b]]Education Programme[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Learning assignment[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from commerce\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Your attendant will encourage the rural peasantry to enlist in public schools, increasing educational standards and incentivising engagement in commerce and trade.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Fealty of the Man[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Faction feature[[/col]]\\n\\n[[i]]Fealties are gained through conquering Nanman factions. Each tribe starts with one Fealty, and must gather the others to unite the tribes.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]The tribes of the Man were always direct, and loyal to a fault.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Secure[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Occupation option[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Replenishment\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Military supply gain\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Only through constant vigilance can we hope to restore China![[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Chen Royal Guard[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Crossbow infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: all-rounder\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good morale\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Good armour\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Heavy missile attacks\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Prince Liu Chong seeks to make a safe land for all. His royal guard will see that vision realised.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Mercenary Captain Retinues[[/b]]\\n\\nThese retinues deploy immediately and do not require mustering time.\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Mercenaries and pirates alike will rally behind those who inspire by courage - and coin. [[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Southern Elephants[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Elephants[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 1 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]]Elephant unit\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Small unit\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Can any warrior stand against a charging elephant?[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Raze[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Occupation option[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Razes the settlement[[/col]]\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Momentum\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Lü Bu only has need for the best! Anything else may burn by the wayside.[[/co]][[/i]]

[[b]]Black Mountain Marauders[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Assault infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 1 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Causes scare\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Guerrilla deployment\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Years of banditry have enabled these troops to sneak behind enemy lines, striking at unsuspecting foes and capturing strategic points.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Captain Retinues[[/b]]\\n\\nInstead of heroic characters, Yuan Shao can employ lower-ranked officers and captains who lead retinues of various unit compositions.\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Leading their men as first amongst equals, captains will follow your orders without hesitation.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Yaoguai Hunters[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Archer infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: suppression\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Poisonous arrows\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Guerilla deployment\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Snipe\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Low morale\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Poor in melee\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The 'yaoguai' demons move unseen and strike with a lethality that is scarcely believable. [[/col]][[/i]]

Unlocked from the start:\\n[[b]]Archery Masters[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Archer infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nRole: suppression\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Missile attack\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Poor in melee\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]] Archers with an unerring eye; their arrows rarely miss their targets.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Tribute Hall[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Governmental building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from tributaries\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Bandits have little time for the hypocrisy of so-called warlords; these tribute buildings provide a place for vassals to pay their respect – in gold.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Government Support[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Agricultural building chain[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from peasantry \\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Food from farming\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Conscription raises troops from the population, improving the efficiency of agricultural garrisons and increasing replenishment across your commanderies.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Trailblazer[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Military Assignment[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Campaign movement range\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Military supplies\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Oil (pre-battle deployable)\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]To find and fight your way though the jungle requires a clear mind.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Imperial Court[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Political actions[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Initial Economy\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Initial Diplomacy\\n[[col:red]]-[[/col]] Initial Military\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Reformed Economy\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Reformed Diplomacy\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Reformed Military\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Within the imperial court, three parties battle for supremacy. You sit in the middle, trying to balance these power blocks using your political influence to enact changes within the court.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Seek Talented Individuals[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Learning assignment[[/col]]\\n\\nChances of finding exceptional characters\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]Your past is irrelevant, only your present worth matters.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Might of the Valley[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Axe infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nRole: shock infantry\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Defence vs. missile\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] High mobility\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Equipped with two handed axes and lightly armoured these units excel in breaking the morale of infantry when flanking and charging.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Infantry of Jing[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Polearm infantry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 3 or higher\\n\\nRole: anti-cavalry\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Armour\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Morale\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[i]]The infantry of Jing are charged to guard the flanks against enemy missiles and brace their spears against cavalry charges.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Xiongnu Cataphracts[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Armoured shock cavalry[[/col]]\\n\\nAvailable for characters rank 6 or higher\\n\\nRole: assault\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Great charge\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Great armour\\n\\n[[col:flavour]][[col:flavour]][[i]]Those from beyond our borders may seem strange, but if they fight well it is better that they are on our side.[[/col]][[/i]]

[[b]]Military Government[[/b]]\\n[[col:scope_description]]Governmental building chain\\n\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] Income from all sources\\n[[col:green]]-[[/col]]Military construction costs\\n[[col:green]]+[[/col]] {{tr:Public_order}}\\n\\n[[i]][[col:flavour]]Rule by the sword to evade the ambiguities and trappings of bureaucracy; this government is run with the discipline of a military command.[[/col]][[/i]]
